page.title: 20A DAY IN THE LIFE...
page.content: of{Tracy Archibald { }On the 27th June 1985 some of the {Guides}and{Brownies}from the{1st {Natland Companies}met on platform one of{Oxenholme Station}ready to meet the 10.15 train. Our Guide leader, Mrs. Usher,arrived bringing the 150 button-hole flower arrangements we had made the day before. We planned to give them away to passengers stepping off the train, as part of our {75 years of Guiding celebrations;}to get one all a person had to do was smile! The 10.15 train did not provide us with all the customers we required so we waited for the next one. Most people were pleased to receive the flowers but others were not so polite. Most people cheered up when they found out that their button-holes were not going to cost them any money!
